text: Draft at Buskers bar Roma Italy 04.12.2015.Taste with ippopotamo36 bro, Mortlach, cika Boban.Pour it hazy golden color with small white head.Aroma malty. Taste quite light and watery, malt present all the time.Ok finish for today lets go home budale.
Draft at Buskers, Rome. Hazy, yellow gold. Stringy soapy head. Yeasty malt, very dry bitter finish. Good juicy hop in middle, finishes very dry with yeast and grain. Nice, solid beer!

On tap at Buskers pub in Rome-Italy, with luttonm. Pours an extremely cloudy golden color, frothy off white cap. Nose: yeasty, farmhouse, herbal. Mouth: distinctive bitterness of grapefruit, grass. Malts as well. Nice beer, different golden ale. Well done!

300 ml on tap at Spring Beer Festival 2015. Dark gold, pretty hazy, with a big, fluffy, forever lasting white head. Fresh hop notes on the nose, quite dank and slightly citrusy. Freshly cut grass reminiscence as well. More than average herbal astringency upfront, pleasent rooty and hoppy taste, relatively refreshing with a dry finish. Nice, but I would score it so much higher if that astringency wasnt so dominant..

Buonissima golden ale! Dorata torbida con schiuma bianca. Al naso note di luppolo resinose. In bocca corpo medio e bilanciata verso lamaro molto molto gradebole. Sapore floreale molto intenso che finisce con secchezza ed amarezza. Una birra molto consigliata!

Questi buskers si piazzano con un ottimo prodotto, dalla luppolatura intensa e agrumata! Molto equilibrata e saporita, ma effettivamente resta ben poco di una golden ale. Meglio così, il luppolo da carattere!!

Bottle @ Bir & Fud Bottega, Roma (special thanks to Mirko). Clear golden beer with white head. Sweetish malty aroma with lots of pine, hops and citrus.Flavour is bitter and dry but not overly so. Very well made golden ale with more than a fistful of hops.
Belle e buona, ma potrebbe essere molto meglio per me.Il Citra ha mi ha decisamente stufato, invasivo e totalizzante penso possa essere usato con meno decisione!

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ della birra: Golden, white foam, citrus at nose with orange and grapefruit. Fantastic beer, very bitter, medium body, refreshing with an amazing very long finish. I dont if its a golden ale, but its very good.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Nebuloso color giallo chiaro con un velo di schiuma bianca molto cremosa. Laroma colpisce con intense note erbacee e floreali e leggeri sentori agrumati e resinosi. Gusto amaro sorprendentemente luppolato, ma tutto sommato morbido al palato: beverina e dissetante nonostante il retrogusto amarissimo e secco. Birra notevole, facilmente confondibile con una IPA o una APA.
Bevuta recentemente appena ribrassata, mi ha decisamente e favorevolmente colpito. Naso molto luppolaggiante per lo stile, e anche in bocca rotonda e appagante. Molto bene...

Tasted from bottle - October 2011. 
Deep golden color white a white head not too persistent. Nose is pronounced with hop sensation like citrus fruits and grassy note. On taste there is a little and fast honey sensation deriving from malt and an impressive hop feeling herbaceous and flowery. The bitterness is really long but not discourages from having a second taste and the dry finish makes this beer very drinkable.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2012 Pours transparent gold with a large white head.  Nose is malty sweetness, citrus, pineapple and pine cones.  Flavor is bitter through and through, balanced enough to make the hop flavor under control and not overwhelming.  Wonderful flavor.  Mothfeel is oily and sharp, medium to heavy body.  This beer is a knock out for the Italians!
chiara buona schiuma persitente naso luppolato ercaeeo leggermente citrico piuttosto secca amaro deciso erbaceo lievemente agrumato finale non troppo lungo

22710/2011 La Tana (tap). Dorata, intensa, leggermente torbida, schiuma liquida e pannosa bianco-sporca, molto persistente. Aroma intenso di luppoli, agrumati, con note erbacee e di frutta. In bocca è amara senza compromessi e molto persistente, ma senza nulla togliere alla beverinità. Corpo medio, consistenza oleosa, carbonazione corretta. Davvero molto buona.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2012 Draft @ Birra+/open baladin Roma. Bottle @ Bir & Fud Roma and Home. Golden/orange color, quite cloudy. White big head, not really rocky and persistent. 
The aroma is aggressive, a punch of hop, citrus, mature orange; a little bit grassy. On the taste you can get a Belgian malt character (i recognized the olmaia mark for sure) with a light body (a little bit heavier on draft) at first, but you have no time to think about it cause a strong APA hopiness invades your mouth with a lot of hop, citrus and flower/grassy sensations.
The taste is bitter, no doubt about it, BUT i dont got the "killer bitterness" every one is talking about. In general its strong bitterness is well balanced by the rest.
The finlsh is really, really, and i mean R_E_A_L_L_Y long, one of the longest mouthfeel i ever noticed in a beer. Not so dry but bitter anyhow, as soon as you finish it, Youll find that Drinking a second (or a third, forth) one is not even an option, is mandatory! A great session, but full of taste, beer. 
Not forget to mention the amazing label. Maybe the best Italian one so far.
Brilliant start for the beer buskers.

Draft @ Karhisma Birroteca (Piedimonte Matese, Caserta - Italy). Pale and hazy orange color, something gold but really cloudy in the end. White head, big bubbles with good lacing. Little yeasty aroma, but HEAVILY hopped, really strong, you could smell at distance: like a fresh-cutted lawn; flower-field, apricot and grapefruit notes. A light body begins with a classic belgian ale opening full of honey, citrus, apricot again, sugar, that turns immediatly to something bitter, bitter, really bitter: resinous, herbaceous, it carries to a dry finish that lasts so long and call back another sip. Maximum drinkability, great session beer.
Molto buona questa pale ale, bellissimo il naso, un po troppo amara, ma ha personalità e come prima birra va benissimo.
Beh non ci andiamo male con la prima birra del progetto Buskers; pale ale molto corretta, ben profumata. bene,o!
